comments.body: Maybe worth using `corev1.PreemptLowerPriority` to ensure there's no typo.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +75,79 @@	return &PriorityClassOptions{
		Value:            0,
		PreemptionPolicy: "PreemptLowerPriority",
		PrintFlags:       genericclioptions.NewPrintFlags("created").WithTypeSetter(scheme.Scheme),
		IOStreams:        ioStreams,

comments.body:
You're missing:
```go
		// this is ok because we know exactly how we want to be serialized
		TypeMeta: metav1.TypeMeta{APIVersion: scheduling.SchemeGroupVersion.String(), Kind: "PriorityClass"},
```
here
done et rebased on master ðŸ™‚

This is having problems b/c you miss setting that `TypeMeta` below, which ends up kubectl asking the server for support for non-existent GVK. When you add that, you'll notice that these two lines are passing https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/396b90f06ca29c754a81eb6c03cff50b7d9bf265/test/cmd/core.sh#L292-L293

It's best to look through logs looking for last logs with line numbers and try to figure out which might have failed. In your case you'll notice:
```
core.sh:290: Successful get priorityclasses {{range.items}}{{ if eq .metadata.name \"test-priorityclass\" }}found{{end}}{{end}}:: :
```
so the next lines of actual code are those create lines I've pointed out earlier. Running locally both will reveal the problem is with the next and from here it's pretty easy to nail down the actual code issue ;)

Great! Thank you for taking the time to walk me through it @soltysh ðŸ™‚
Next time I should be more comfortable.
